clean_story: "Enlightenment. Balance. Eastern philosophy's Buddhism and Taoism, born centuries apart, share this pursuit. 'Buddha' means 'awakened one. ' Siddhartha Gautama, around 500 BCE, sought the cause of suffering and found the Eightfold Path to end it. Taoism's Laozi, centuries later, sought harmony with the natural flow, the Tao. Both reject rigid dogma, embracing personal experience and introspection. Buddhism's Four Noble Truths diagnose suffering, while Taoism's Wu wei teaches effortless action. Both emphasize mindfulness and simplicity. In practice, Buddhism's meditation and ethical guidelines guide daily life, while Taoism's spontaneity and naturalness shape art and society. Three related subjects are the influence of these philosophies on modern mindfulness, their impact on art and literature, and the debate over their compatibility with science. "
